wikipedia_page.main: Alma Murray (1854–1945) was an English actress.

response: After receiving a desperate cable from Farr, Shaw delivered his Arms and the Man. With only one week of rehearsal, Farr originated the supporting soubrette role of Louka, the vivacious and insolent servant girl who steals the affections of the hero from the play's lead ingenue, which Farr had conceded to the well-known actress Alma Murray. A bold satire of romantic idealism, the play was a great success with both audiences and critics, and still stands as one of Shaw's greatest works. But Farr was growing closer to Yeats (that they became lovers is speculated but not proven) and distancing herself from Shaw, so Arms was the last play by Shaw she ever performed in.

Henry Buxton Forman was born in Camberwell, south London on 11 July 1842, the third son of George Ellery Forman (born Plymouth in 1800, died London in 1869), a retired Royal Naval surgeon and his Sussex born wife Maria Courthorpe. At the age of ten months his family moved to Teignmouth in Devon and he was educated at a Royal Naval School in New Cross where Edmund Gosse was a contemporary and lifelong acquaintance although not an intimate. Whilst at school he adapted the sobriquet Harry by which he was afterwards known. He returned to London in 1860 and lived with his brothersHis older brother Alfred William Forman, later a published poet was the first person to translate into English the librettos of several Richard Wagner's operas including Der Ring des Nibelungen(1877), Tristan und Isolde (1891), Parsifal (1899), and Tannhäuser (1919). He married the actress Alma Murray in 1876 in Stockwell in south London after joining the Post Office at 18 years of age.

Sellé was awarded a Lambeth Music Doctorate by Archbishop Sumner in 1857.Correspondence in the Lambeth Palace Archives from 1857 The 1850s to the 1860s were his most prolific as a composer. The British Library archive has around forty published pieces by Sellé and Cambridge University Library has eleven.University of Cambridge Library Musical Catalogue The majority are from the middle decades of the century. They  are relatively short pieces for the piano and organ. The  piano compositions are light and easily accessible in style, essentially salon pieces. His work illustrates his love of the composers of the First Viennese School and places Sellé within the romantic tradition of English music. In 1886, he was commissioned by The Shelley Society to provide music for Hellas, a lyrical drama by Percy Bysshe Shelley.Hellas: A lyrical drama by Percy Bysshe Shelley. The choruses set to music by William Christian Sellé, The Shelley Society, Spottiswoode 1886 This was performed in October 1894 with the actress Alma Murray in the lead role. The musical score came in for much artistic criticismCollins, John (1992). The Two Forgers: A Biography of Harry Buxton Forman and Thomas James Wise. New Castle, Delaware, USA: Oak Knoll Press.  but remains Sellé's best known score and is still available and in print.Hellas, A Lyrical Drama by Percy Byssche Shelley edited by H Buxton Forman, choruses by W C Sellé, Publisher Nabu (2010)
